item.title: Where is Bart Simpson’s Treehouse in Fortnite? Mysterious Anomaly, Explained
item.content:encoded:
The Simpsons are on their way to Fortnite, and it appears Bart Simpson is the first to make his arrival, as his iconic treehouse can be found on the Battle Royale island, and we’ll tell you exactly where to go.

Fortnite’s mini-season themed around The Simpsons kicks off this week, starting with a huge live event, which marks the final part of Chapter 6 in the game, with Epic Games now gearing up for the big release of Chapter 7 at the start of December.

Ahead of the big live event, a new quest is live in Fortnite that tasks you to investigate the Mysterious Anomaly, and we’ve got a full breakdown of where you need to go.

How to Find The Mysterious Anomaly in Fortnite

The Mysterious Anomaly in Fortnite, aka Bart Simpson’s treehouse, is located in the northwestern part of the map, close to the Creepy Camps POI.

Approaching this location, you’ll immediately spot a cell-shaded treehouse that sticks out like a sore thumb compared to the rest of the environment, which serves as a huge teaser ahead of the Simpsons-themed mini-season that will serve as the final swansong of Chapter 6 in Fortnite.

To claim the 20,000 XP and complete the quest, which provides a huge bump to your season level and can help you unlock any remaining rewards from the Battle Pass and Fortnitemares, simply approach the Treehouse. When you appear close enough, the challenge will automatically tick off and provide the reward.

There’s no need to head inside the treehouse, but if you do, you’ll be treated to another mini easter egg for the forthcoming season, with a TV that has a sketchy signal in the corner of the building. Periodically, images will flash up with memes from The Simpsons, another major hint at what is coming.

Are There Any Other Simpsons Easter Eggs in Fortnite?

Yes, there are other Simpsons-themed easter eggs located on the Fortnite app, though none of the others provide an additional quest or XP bonuses.

In the Steamy Shacks location, a workstation very similar to Homer Simpson’s at the nuclear power plant can be found, with no secret as to who it belongs to, as pink-glazed donuts are also there, many of which have had a bite taken out of them.

Additional teasers could be added before the start of the live event this weekend, but it’s not too long to wait now until the big reveal of everything there is to enjoy.

What do you want to see added to Fortnite in Chapter 7? Let us know your suggestions in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out all the leaked Simpsons skins coming in the Fortnite collab, and read about claims that a South Park collab is planned for the future.

item.title: All Leaked Fortnite x The Simpsons Skins, Listed
item.content:encoded:
The current season in Fortnite, along with the heap of collabs in the Fortnitemares event, is rapidly approaching its conclusion, with all eyes cast towards The Simpsons mini-season, and we’ve already seen a bunch of leaked skins.

The Simpsons are making a long-awaited arrival in the world of Fortnite this week, with a live event set to kick off the huge collab, with a month-long stage in the spotlight before Chapter 6 comes to an end and Chapter 7 begins.

Leaks for the big Simpsons takeover in Fortnite have already emerged, and we’ve highlighted all of the skins that are coming to the game as part of the update.

All Leaked Fortnite x The Simpsons Skins

Keyart leaked for Fortnite, and a small batch teased by Epic Games themselves, has provided a first look at a total of 12 skins coming in The Simpsons mini-season.

As usual, a bunch of skins will be available as part of the Battle Pass, now included with a Game Pass subscription, and the usual approach is that characters front and center of keyart will be included in the Pass.

Therefore, we expect Homer, Marge, Simpsons Jonesy, and Simpsons Hope to be included in the Battle Pass skins, while Ned Flanders could be the final reward, along with his trademark moustache-styled glider.

Other skins could still be included in the Battle Pass, but we’ll have to wait and see. There’s plenty more to come in the Item Shop though via V-Bucks purchases, including Lisa Simpson and Krusty the Clown.

As usual, many of the skins will be NPCs to interact with on the map, with Moe Syslak standing out as the leading candidate for that regard, with his bar likely to be a POI, while Lisa Simpson could potentially be found the the school. Again, we’ll have to wait for full confirmation.

Check out the table below for all the leaked Simpsons skins in the Fortnite collab.

Which Simpsons character do you want to see receive a skin during the Fortnite collab? Let us know in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out claims that a South Park collab is coming soon, and read about Steal A Brainrot developers suing a Fortnite copycat.

item.title: Heads Please Codes (October 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Heads Please monthly redeem codes for October 2025 to get ahead of the competition. These codes can give you free rewards including Yut, Enchant Books rare coins, boosters and much more.

Heads Please (also known as Heads, Please!) is a coin-flip-based RNG Roblox experience where you spin Coins and aim to land on the obverse side to earn the maximum amount of Wones. You’ll still earn a small number of Wones when flipping tails, but to obtain the best Coins, such as the Seraphim Coin, Anti Gravity Coin, Unsteady Coin, and many more, you’ll need not only Lady Fortuna’s blessing but also Gacha Luck, Wones, and boosters.

Instead of spending Robux on these resources, you can simply redeem active Heads Please codes. These codes are easy to use and can help you climb the global leaderboards in just a few sessions.

Active Heads Please Codes

Inactive Heads Please Codes

  • Thxfor7KAP
  • Thxfor8KAP
  • sryforshutdownagain
  • ThxFor700AP
  • ThxForActivePlayer3000
  • ThxForGroup20k
  • ThxFor10kMembers
  • ThxFor500Likes
  • HugeUpdate
  • EnchantBook
  • FLIPCOIN

How To Redeem Heads Please Codes

Steps to redeem the active Heads Please codes are listed below: 

  1. Launch Heads Please and spawn on the map. 
  2. Hit the coupon icon located under the settings logo on the right side of the screen.
  3. Input the active code into the “ENTER THE CODE” text box. 
  4. Now, press the “USE” button to redeem the code. 

More About Heads Please Codes 

Here are all the Coins from the Coin Shop with their roll chance: 

  • Basic Coin 1/1
  • Cardboard Coin 1/3
  • Leaf Coin 1/6
  • Jelly Coin 1/8
  • Waffle Coin 1/13
  • Silver Coin 1/17
  • Plate Coin 1/22
  • Cat Coin 1/30
  • Gold Coin 1/45
  • Intermediate Coin 1/100
  • Bomb Coin 1/300
  • Magma Coin 1/300
  • Advanced Coin 1/500
  • Yin Coin 1/750 
  • Yang Coin 1/750
  • Luminous Coin 1/1500
  • Gamble Core Coin 1/2000
  • Unsteady Coin 1/3000
  • AntiGravity Coin 1/4000
  • Seraphim Coin 1/10,000,000

Yut obtained from the codes can be accessed from the inventory. Simply head to the inventory or press “E” to open the dialog box. Now, select “ITEMS” to see the newly obtained Yut. You get 0-5 Songpyeon by throwing (using) the Yut stick. Boosters claimed from the codes are automatically applied to your account as soon as you redeem the specific code. 

Where To Find New Heads Please Codes?

One of the best ways to stay up-to-date with the active codes for Heads Please is to follow our active codes list. This is because new codes will be added there as soon as they debut. For even more information, you can consider joining the game’s official Discord server. 

Enjoying our Roblox games codes coverage? Check out the codes for popular games like Steal A Brainrot, Radiant Residents, and Fix It Up on Insider Gaming!

Interested in the latest developments in the world of gaming and esports? Then join the Insider Gaming Discord server and engage with the passionate community.

item.title: New Sims Games Coming to Xbox and PlayStation, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
A reputable source has claimed that MySims, an adorable version of the popular life simulation series, is set to arrive on PlayStation and Xbox later this year. MySims first surfaced in 2007 on the Nintendo DS and Nintendo Wii, before expanding to PC, mobile platforms, and in 2024, the Nintendo Switch.

This marks the first time that MySims will be available to play on Xbox or PlayStation, and fans of the franchise are excited. The MySims: Cozy Bundle, which was recently announced for Apple Arcade (November 6), will arrive on PS5 and Xbox Series platforms from November 18.

More Sims in MySims

In an exclusive report published by Dealabs, backed by leading industry insiders, it was claimed that MySims: Cozy Bundle will be released on Xbox Series X, Xbox Series X, and PlayStation 5 on November 18, 2025. It was stressed that the game will be priced at $39.99.

The bundle includes the original MySims game, released almost 20 years ago, and MySkins: Kingdom. They’re remastered version of the original titles, though.

MySims is something along the lines of The Sims fused with Animal Crossing, presenting players with a cutesy take on the life sim that was first released way back in 2000. It was a spin-off of sorts from SimCity, with developers wanting to explore a more granular take on the city builder, zooming in and allowing players to simulate a life of their dreams.

As the MySims Cosy Bundle is set to drop exactly one year after it was released on Nintendo Switch, it’s easy to assume that an exclusivity deal was arranged between Electronic Arts and the Japanese gaming titan.

The ‘retro re-release’ of MySims has been met with excitement from fans of the franchise. It has been a while since we had a new Sims game, given that The Sims 4 is now a free-to-play, live-service game, and anyone who hasn’t played MySims before is hungry to experience all it has to offer.

Are you eager to check out MySims: Cozy Bundle? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that new Marathon leaks are looking positive
